+ LINKLATERS LLP [3 Press Releases]

+ LINKLATERS ADVISES TRUSTEE OF ROLLS-ROYCE UKPENSION FUND ON £4.3BN BUY-IN WITH PENSION INSURANCE CORPORATION

Linklaters has advised the trustee of the Rolls-Royce UK Pension Fund on its £4.3bn bulk annuity insurance 'buy-in' with Pension Insurance Corporation (PIC), in the largest de-risking transaction announced in 2025.

The transaction will fully insure benefits payable from the Fund, providing certainty and security for the defined benefit scheme's 36,000 members.

The Linklaters team comprised Claire Petheram, John Sheppard and Rebecca Fellas.

Source: Company Website

+ LINKLATERS ADVISES AB&B BIO-TECH ON ITS HKEX IPO

Linklaters acted as the Hong Kong and US counsel for Ab&B Bio-Tech CO., LTD. JS (Ab&B Bio-Tech) on its global offering and listing of H shares on the Main Board of the Hong Kong Stock Exchange (HKEX) under Chapter 18A of the Hong Kong Listing Rules. The Hong Kong public offering was oversubscribed by over 4,000 times, making it one of the most popular new listings this year.

Founded in 2015, Ab&B Bio-Tech is a China-based vaccine company dedicated to the research, development, manufacturing and commercialisation of innovative vaccines and traditional vaccines adopting new technical methods.

The Linklaters team was led by partner and Head of Greater China ECM Christine Xu, capital markets partner Lipton Li and Special Senior Adviser and New Economy Team Leader (Greater China) Oliver Zhong, with support from corporate counsel Queenie Tong.

Partner and Head of Greater China ECM Christine Xu commented:

"Many congratulations to Ab&B Bio-Tech on this successful IPO! This transaction underscores the continued attractiveness of Hong Kong SAR as a listing destination and showcases Linklaters' depth of expertise in advising fast-growing, innovative biotech companies on capital raising from public markets including achieving transformative milestones such as IPOs." Linklaters' highly experienced Greater China ECM team provides seamless legal support on pre-IPO investments, IPOs, post-listing compliance and post-IPO equity financing, including advising on the recent HKEX IPOs of CATL, Sanhua Intelligent and FWD Group, as well as share placings for Innovent Biologics, Keymed Biosciences, Minieye Technology and RoboSense.

Source: Company Website

+ LINKLATERS ADVISES BBVA, CITIGROUP, DEUTSCHE BANK, J.P. MORGAN AND SANTANDER ON TELECOM ARGENTINA S.A.'S US$200 MILLION BOND REOPENING

Linklaters advised BBVA Securities Inc., Citigroup Global Markets Inc., Deutsche Bank Securities Inc., J.P. Morgan Securities LLC, and Santander US Capital Markets LLC in connection with Telecom's 144A/Regulation S cross-border offering of US$200 million aggregate principal amount of notes, as part of the reopening of its 9.250% senior notes due 2033. The offering was launched on July 22, 2025, priced on July 24, 2025, and closed on July 29, 2025. The notes are expected to be listed on the Bolsa y Mercados Argentinos S.A. (BYMA) and the Luxembourg Stock Exchange, and admitted for trading on A3 Mercados S.A.

Telecom has been at the forefront of the telecommunications industry in Argentina, Paraguay, and Uruguay, offering fixed-line telephony, mobile communications, optical fiber, cable television, and broadband services. The proceeds of the offering will be used to partially prepay existing loans in connection with Telecom's acquisition of Telefonica Moviles Argentina S.A.

The Linklaters deal team was led by Partners Matthew Poulter and Emilio Minvielle, supported by Associates Madeleine Blehaut and Thomas Tiphaine Koffman, Staff Attorney Leticia Correia, and Paralegal Intern Andre Benicio. Additional tax assistance for the deal was provided by Partner Gabriel Grossman and Senior Associate Bernard Yi.

Linklaters' lawyers have practiced in Latin America for decades and the firm was one of the first international firms to open an office in Brazil in 1997. With a growing team of Latin America-focused lawyers across the firm's New York, Washington, D.C., and Sao Paulo offices, the firm continues to increase its presence in the Latin America region and deepen existing relationships with leading local law firms. Linklaters is highly ranked across key Latin America legal directories including Chambers, Legal 500, and Latin Lawyer.

Source: Company Website

DASHBOARD: FRESHFIELDS BRUCKHAUS DERINGER LLP

PermID5000013096Websitehttp://www.freshfields.comIndustryLegal Services

ACTIVITIES:

Freshfields Bruckhaus Deringer LLP, founded in 1743, is a global law firm headquartered in London, UK. With over 2,800 lawyers across 28 offices in 17 countries, it generates approximately 1.8 billion in annual revenue. Specializing in M&A, finance, and litigation, Freshfields advises clients like RELX and ENEOS on cross-border transactions and regulatory issues. Known for its 275-year history with the Bank of England, it expanded its U.S. presence in 2024 with key hires in antitrust and tax. Competing with Clifford Chance and Linklaters, Freshfields mission is to deliver elite legal solutions, combining global expertise with innovative strategies.

+ FRESHFIELDS BRUCKHAUS DERINGER LLP [3 Press Releases]

+ FRESHFIELDS ADVISES PROSIEBENSAT.1 MEDIA ON AMENDED TAKEOVER BID BY MFEIN BIDDING COMPETITION

Global law firm Freshfields is advising SDAX-listed ProSiebenSat.1 Media SE ("ProSiebenSat.1") on the amended public takeover bid by Italian media group MFE-MEDIAFOREUROPE N.V. ("MFE") against the background of the competing public acquisition offer in the form of a partial bid by PPF IM LTD ("PPF"), an indirect subsidiary of Czech investment group PPF Group N.V.

Source : Company Website

+ FRESHFIELDS ADVISES ON SUNSHINE LAKE PHARMAS PRIVATISATION OF YICHANG HEC PHARMACEUTICAL AND ITS CONCURRENT LISTING ON HKSE

Global law firm Freshfields has advised CICC as sole sponsor and financial adviser to Sunshine Lake Pharma in relation to Sunshine Lake Pharma's privatisation of HKSE-listed YiChang HEC Changjiang Pharmaceutical by way of merger by absorption and the concurrent listing of the H shares of Sunshine Lake Pharma by way of introduction on the HKSE.

Source: Company Website

+ FRESHFIELDS ADVISES NATURGY ON A SALE OF SHARES WORTH 1.4BN TO INCREASE ITS FREE FLOAT

Global law firm Freshfields has advised multinational energy group Naturgy on the successful sale of treasury shares representing 5.5% of its share capital. This transaction has enabled Naturgy to increase its free float on the Spanish Stock Exchanges to approximately 15.1%, providing liquidity to its shares, facilitating the entry of new investors and facilitating its inclusion in main stock market indices, such as the MSCI.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM & WATKINS LLP [9 Press Releases]

+ LATHAM & WATKINS ADVISES ON INDIANAPOLIS POWER & LIGHT COMPANY'S US$350 MILLION FIRST MORTGAGE BONDS OFFERING

Indianapolis Power & Light Company, a subsidiary of IPALCO Enterprises, Inc. and The AES Corporation, which does business as AESIndiana, announced and priced an offering of US$350 million aggregate principal amount of a new series of 5.050% First Mortgage Bonds due 2035 in a private offering under Rule 144A and Regulation S of the Securities Act of 1933 to eligible purchasers.

Latham & Watkins LLP represents the underwriters in the offering with a Capital Markets team led by partner Brittany Ruiz, with associates Robyn Sablove, Alex Gulino, and Jackie Stern. Advice was also provided on tax matters by partner Bora Bozkurt, with associate Joyce Shin; on energy regulatory matters by partner Tyler Brown and counsel Jamie Blackburn; and on environmental matters by Gary Gengel, with associates Tal Carmeli and Gina Kwon.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM & WATKINS ADVISES SKYDANCE MEDIAIN COMPLETED MERGER WITH PARAMOUNT GLOBAL

Skydance Media and Paramount Global announced the completion of their merger, creating a premier standalone global media and entertainment company, Paramount, a Skydance Corporation (Paramount). Paramount Class B shares will begin trading on the Nasdaq Stock Market LLC under the new ticker symbol "PSKY." Supported by RedBird Capital's business building and financial acumen, the newly combined entity will rely on best-in-class leadership and tech-enabled innovation to revitalize and position one of entertainment's most storied enterprises for long-term success.

Latham & Watkins LLP represented Skydance Media and the Investor Group (comprised of the Ellison Family and RedBird Capital Partners) in the transaction with a corporate deal team led by partners Charles Ruck, Ian Nussbaum, Max Schleusener, Rick Offsay, and Liliana Paparelli Ranger, with associates Lauren Lefcoe and Rachelle Polsky. Advice was provided on tax matters by partners Pardis Zomorodi and Katharine Moir and on executive compensation, employment, and benefits matters by partner Julie Crisp.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM REPRESENTS GFL ENVIRONMENTAL INC.IN AGREEMENT TO RECAPITALIZE GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE PARTNERS AT AN ENTERPRISE VALUE OF US$4.25 BILLION WITH INVESTMENT FROM ENERGY CAPITAL PARTNERS

GFL Environmental Inc. (NYSE: GFL) (TSX: GFL), the fourth largest diversified environmental services company in North America, has announced that Green Infrastructure Partners (GIP) has entered into a definitive agreement with funds managed by Energy Capital Partners, LLC (ECP) to recapitalize its business at an enterprise value of US$4.25 billion. GIP is a leading vertically integrated infrastructure company established in 2022 by GFL, funds managed by HPS Investment Partners Inc. and Patrick Dovigi.

Latham & Watkins LLP represented GFL in the transaction with a team led by partners Stelios Saffos and Peter Sluka, Global Co-Chairs of the Hybrid Capital Practice, and partner Sal Vanchieri, with associates Ian Lachow and Elina Stavropoulou. Advice was provided on M&A matters by partner Paul Kukish, Global Co-Chair of the M&A and Private Equity Practice, and partners Michael Vardanian and Matthew Villar, with associate Grant Steiger; and on tax matters by partner Eric Kamerman.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM & WATKINS RANKED AS A TOP LAW FIRM IN LATIN AMERICA

Latham & Watkins was ranked among the top law firms in Latin America in Latinvex's 2025 Top Law Firms List, including Band 1 rankings for Corporate/M&A, Energy, and Project Finance work in the region. The rankings are based on a combination of factors, including value, prominence and scope of work, and feedback from clients and peers.

Latham was ranked in the following categories:

Corporate/M&A Energy Project Finance Arbitration Banking & Finance Capital Markets FCPA & Fraud

Earlier this year Latinvex ranked Latham as the top international law firm in Latin America for M&A in the region and ranked Latham as the top international legal advisor for M&A transactions in Latin America through the first half of 2025. Five members of Latham's Latin America were recently named to Latinvex's Top 100 Lawyers 2025 list.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM & WATKINS ADVISES MAVERICK SILICON INEQUITY INVESTMENT INCELERA SEMICONDUCTOR, A LEADER IN ANALOG DESIGN AUTOMATION FOR THE SEMICONDUCTOR INDUSTRY

Celera Semiconductor, a Silicon Valley startup pioneering analog design automation, has announced a US$20 million equity investment from Maverick Silicon, a private investment firm focused on transformative semiconductor technologies. This strategic financing round positions Celera to bring to market custom analog ICs developed using its patented Nestos(TradeMark) platform - a digital twin-based analog design library that enables rapid, high-precision analog IC development. By automating the most complex parts of the analog design process, Celera is unlocking a new era of "real-time" analog product development for OEM customers across many industries.

Latham & Watkins LLP advised Maverick Silicon in the transaction with a corporate team led by partners John Miller and Haim Zaltzman, with associates Alberto Cabrera Rivera and Jihoo Kim. Advice was also provided on compensation and benefits matters by partner Josh Friedman; and on intellectual property matters with associate Debbie Hinck.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM ADVISES ONTARIO TEACHERS PENSION PLAN ON SALE OF STAKE INDIOT-SIACI GROUP

Latham & Watkins has advised Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan in the sale of its stake in Diot-Siaci Group, a French and European leader in corporate insurance brokerage, to Ardian. Ardian will become the main financial investor alongside the Burrus Group and the management.

The completion of the transaction is contingent upon receiving approval from the relevant regulatory and competition authorities.

The Latham team was led by Paris corporate partner Gaetan Gianasso, with associate Julia Lefevre.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM & WATKINS ADVISES ON STRATEGIC FINANCING TRANSACTION OF UP TO US$500 MILLION FOR BLACKSTONE AND MANNKIND CORPORATION

MannKind Corporation (Nasdaq: MNKD), a company focused on the development and commercialization of inhaled therapeutic products and delivery devices for patients with endocrine and orphan lung diseases, and funds managed by Blackstone, have announced that they have entered into an up to US$500 million strategic financing agreement. The up to US$500 million senior secured credit facility consists of a US$75 million initial term loan funded at closing, a US$125 million delayed draw term loan (DDTL) available for the next 24 months, subject to customary drawdown conditions, and an additional US$300 million uncommitted DDTL available at the mutual consent of MannKind and Blackstone.

Latham & Watkins LLP represents Blackstone in the transaction with a transactional deal team led by partners Haim Zaltzman and Dan Van Fleet, with associates Yesenia Barberena and Kayla Matthews. Advice was also provided on tax matters by partner Eric Cho, with associate Kathryn Harrington; on intellectual property matters by counsel Robert Yeh, with associate Kristina Funahashi; on data privacy and cybersecurity matters by partner Robert Blamires, with associate Kathryn Parsons-Reponte; on healthcare regulatory matters by counsel Nicole Liffrig Molife, with associate Margaret Rote; on FDA matters by partner Ben Haas, with associate Meryl Bartlett; on trade control matters by associate Matthew Crawford; on anti-bribery and anti-corruption matters by associate Lucas Novaes; on capital markets matters by partners Eric Rice and Reza Mojtabaee-Zamani; and on compensation and benefits matters by partner Julie Crisp, with associate Megan Ampe.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM ADVISES UK SPONSORS ON METLEN'S £6 BILLION LONDON LISTING

Latham & Watkins has advised the joint financial advisers and sponsors on the primary listing of Metlen Energy & Metals, a global energy and metals group based in Greece with operations in over 40 countries, on the London Stock Exchange.

Metlen expects to be admitted to the FTSE 100 as early as September 2025, with a market capitalization currently at EUR6.71 billion (approximately £6 billion).

Metlen is retaining a listing on the Athens Stock Exchange, and its shares will continue to be denominated in euros, making it one of the first companies to take advantage of new rules that allow shares not denominated in GBP to be included in the FTSE UK indices.

The Latham team was led by London corporate partners James Inness and Anna Ngo, and counsel Koushik Prasad.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM & WATKINS REPRESENTS EXTRA SPACE STORAGEIN US$800 MILLION SENIOR NOTES OFFERING

Extra Space Storage Inc. (NYSE: EXR), a leading owner and operator of self-storage facilities in the United States and a member of the S&P 500, has announced that its operating partnership, Extra Space Storage LP, has priced a public offering of US$800 million aggregate principal amount of 4.950% senior notes due 2033. The Notes were priced at 99.739% of the principal amount and will mature on January 15, 2033. The offering is expected to close on or about August 8, 2025, subject to the satisfaction of customary closing conditions.

Latham & Watkins LLP represents Extra Space in the offering with a Capital Markets team led by San Diego partners Craig Garner and Kevin Reyes, and counsel Anthony Gostanian, with associates Rachel Staub and Sterling Swift. Advice was also provided on debt finance matters by New York/Los Angeles partner Greg Rodgers, with associate Sara Johnson; and on tax matters by Los Angeles partners Pardis Zomorodi and Eric Cho, with associate Ryan Brenner.

Source: Company Website

+ KIRKLAND & ELLIS [3 Press Releases]

+ KIRKLAND & ELLIS: WIRECARD: GERMAN DISTRICT COURT RULES DOUBLE-DIP STRUCTURE IS ENFORCEABLE

The Munich District Court in July delivered a first-instance verdict in the Wirecard insolvency,1 allowing holders of convertible notes issued by a Wirecard subsidiary and guaranteed by Wirecard to ultimately recover under two separate claims against the estate (double-dip).

Such double-dip structures (and similar) have a long legacy in corporate financing transactions and have become particularly topical in the context of liability management transactions as a tool to maximise creditors' recoveries by establishing multiple independent claims against the same pool of collateral assets. Double-dip financings can be used to raise new money, address maturities and reduce interest expense; the structure can incentivise creditor participation, given participating creditors receive "two bites at the apple" without technically priming existing creditors.

Source: Company Website

+ KIRKLAND EXPANDS PRODUCT LIABILITY AND MASS TORT LITIGATION PRACTICE WITH ADDITION OF BURT SNELL

Kirkland & Ellis announced today that product liability and mass tort litigator Nils B. (Burt) Snell has joined the Firm as a partner.

"Burt brings exceptional depth and experience to our market-leading litigation practice," said Andrew Kassof, a member of Kirkland's Executive Committee. "His addition marks an important step in building out our best-in-class product liability and mass tort capabilities, especially on the international and regulatory side, while also supporting the continued growth of our Philadelphia office."

Source: Company Website

+ KIRKLAND ADVISES PERISCOPE EQUITY ON CLOSE OF $370 MILLION OVERSUBSCRIBED THIRD FUND

Kirkland & Ellis advised Periscope Equity, a Chicago-based private equity firm, on the close of Periscope Equity III, L.P., with aggregate commitments of $370 million, exceeding its target of $300 million in under 12 months from official launch. Fund III's investor base comprises both new and returning limited partners, featuring a diverse mix of leading university endowments, pension funds, charitable foundations, consultants, funds-of-funds and family offices. Since 2018, Periscope has raised approximately $700 million in committed capital across its three funds, invested in 11 platform companies and completed 28 add-on acquisitions.

Source: Company Website

+ LINKLATERS LLP [3 Press Releases]

+ LINKLATERS ADVISES TRUSTEE OF ROLLS-ROYCE UKPENSION FUND ON £4.3BN BUY-IN WITH PENSION INSURANCE CORPORATION

Linklaters has advised the trustee of the Rolls-Royce UK Pension Fund on its £4.3bn bulk annuity insurance 'buy-in' with Pension Insurance Corporation (PIC), in the largest de-risking transaction announced in 2025.

The transaction will fully insure benefits payable from the Fund, providing certainty and security for the defined benefit scheme's 36,000 members.

The Linklaters team comprised Claire Petheram, John Sheppard and Rebecca Fellas.

Source: Company Website

+ LINKLATERS ADVISES AB&B BIO-TECH ON ITS HKEX IPO

Linklaters acted as the Hong Kong and US counsel for Ab&B Bio-Tech CO., LTD. JS (Ab&B Bio-Tech) on its global offering and listing of H shares on the Main Board of the Hong Kong Stock Exchange (HKEX) under Chapter 18A of the Hong Kong Listing Rules. The Hong Kong public offering was oversubscribed by over 4,000 times, making it one of the most popular new listings this year.

Founded in 2015, Ab&B Bio-Tech is a China-based vaccine company dedicated to the research, development, manufacturing and commercialisation of innovative vaccines and traditional vaccines adopting new technical methods.

The Linklaters team was led by partner and Head of Greater China ECM Christine Xu, capital markets partner Lipton Li and Special Senior Adviser and New Economy Team Leader (Greater China) Oliver Zhong, with support from corporate counsel Queenie Tong.

Partner and Head of Greater China ECM Christine Xu commented:

"Many congratulations to Ab&B Bio-Tech on this successful IPO! This transaction underscores the continued attractiveness of Hong Kong SAR as a listing destination and showcases Linklaters' depth of expertise in advising fast-growing, innovative biotech companies on capital raising from public markets including achieving transformative milestones such as IPOs." Linklaters' highly experienced Greater China ECM team provides seamless legal support on pre-IPO investments, IPOs, post-listing compliance and post-IPO equity financing, including advising on the recent HKEX IPOs of CATL, Sanhua Intelligent and FWD Group, as well as share placings for Innovent Biologics, Keymed Biosciences, Minieye Technology and RoboSense.

Source: Company Website

+ LINKLATERS ADVISES BBVA, CITIGROUP, DEUTSCHE BANK, J.P. MORGAN AND SANTANDER ON TELECOM ARGENTINA S.A.'S US$200 MILLION BOND REOPENING

Linklaters advised BBVA Securities Inc., Citigroup Global Markets Inc., Deutsche Bank Securities Inc., J.P. Morgan Securities LLC, and Santander US Capital Markets LLC in connection with Telecom's 144A/Regulation S cross-border offering of US$200 million aggregate principal amount of notes, as part of the reopening of its 9.250% senior notes due 2033. The offering was launched on July 22, 2025, priced on July 24, 2025, and closed on July 29, 2025. The notes are expected to be listed on the Bolsa y Mercados Argentinos S.A. (BYMA) and the Luxembourg Stock Exchange, and admitted for trading on A3 Mercados S.A.

Telecom has been at the forefront of the telecommunications industry in Argentina, Paraguay, and Uruguay, offering fixed-line telephony, mobile communications, optical fiber, cable television, and broadband services. The proceeds of the offering will be used to partially prepay existing loans in connection with Telecom's acquisition of Telefonica Moviles Argentina S.A.

The Linklaters deal team was led by Partners Matthew Poulter and Emilio Minvielle, supported by Associates Madeleine Blehaut and Thomas Tiphaine Koffman, Staff Attorney Leticia Correia, and Paralegal Intern Andre Benicio. Additional tax assistance for the deal was provided by Partner Gabriel Grossman and Senior Associate Bernard Yi.

Linklaters' lawyers have practiced in Latin America for decades and the firm was one of the first international firms to open an office in Brazil in 1997. With a growing team of Latin America-focused lawyers across the firm's New York, Washington, D.C., and Sao Paulo offices, the firm continues to increase its presence in the Latin America region and deepen existing relationships with leading local law firms. Linklaters is highly ranked across key Latin America legal directories including Chambers, Legal 500, and Latin Lawyer.

Source: Company Website

NYSE STOCK REPORT

AECOM (NYSE:ACM), the NYSE's 8th largest Construction company by market cap, is up 12% Year to Date. There have been changes in analyst ratings and target prices in 2025 - some forward-looking and others that have been after price movements. Below are the recent analyst ratings changes and the change in company stock price since.

AECOM Snapshot

AECOM Latest Earnings Highlights

Highlights of the Latest Earnings Report Q2 Fiscal 2025

AECOM posted adjusted earnings per share (EPS) of $1.25, exceeding forecasts by 8.7% and marking a 20% increase compared to the previous year.

Revenues experienced a decline year-over-year, though net service revenues (NSR) rose by 1%, reaching $742 million, supported by strong performance in the United Kingdom and Hong Kong markets.

Operating cash flow significantly increased by 102% to $191 million, while adjusted free cash flow surged by 141% to $178 million.

The company's total backlog climbed to $17.78 billion, compared to $17.38 billion during the same period last year, securing strong future revenue opportunities.

Guidance for fiscal 2025 was raised, with adjusted EPS projected between $5.10 and $5.20 and adjusted EBITDA between $1.180 and $1.210 billion, alongside NSR growth expectations of 5-8%.

Adjusted EBITDA margins are anticipated to improve by 30 basis points, ranging from 16.1% to 16.3%, with over 100% conversion from adjusted net income to free cash flow expected.

International revenues dropped by 3% to $875 million; however, operational improvements contributed to a margin expansion of 10 basis points, reaching 11.1%.

Analyst Commentary

Strong Margin Expansion and Operational Efficiency

Observers highlight AECOM's ongoing progress towards achieving its goal of a 17%-plus margin. This success is attributed to a strategic focus on high-margin markets and efficient project execution processes that enhance profitability.

Operational efficiency, supported by disciplined cost management, has enabled reinvestment into high-return initiatives, further strengthening long-term competitiveness.

Robust Cash Flow and Capital Allocation

Exceptional free cash flow growth of 141% underscores the company's healthy financial position. This robust cash flow supports disciplined strategies, including consistent share repurchases and annual dividend growth commitments exceeding 20%.

Resilient Backlog and Pipeline Growth

AECOM's record-breaking backlog of $17.78 billion and a book-to-burn ratio of 1.2x in its design business signify continued demand. The infrastructure and environmental sectors are noted as drivers propelling global growth opportunities.

Exposure to High-Growth Markets

Growth in strategic areas such as transportation, water, and environmental services positions AECOM to leverage rising global investments in sustainable infrastructure. Advancements in AI and digital technologies further highlight avenues for growth in high-demand segments.

Challenges in Revenue Growth and International Markets

Challenges persist as revenues declined year-over-year, with international performance impacted by currency fluctuations and market-specific factors. Nonetheless, the company's focus on organic growth initiatives provides strategic support against these challenges.

Optimism for Long-Term Prospects

Industry-wide optimism underscores AECOM's resilience and alignment with essential global trends such as urbanization and climate change. Its steady earnings growth and ability to mitigate economic uncertainties affirm confidence in its long-term trajectory.

Company Profile

AECOM is recognized as a global leader in infrastructure consulting services, offering comprehensive solutions in planning, design, engineering, construction management, and advisory sectors. The Americas represent its largest source of revenue, driven by transportation and water infrastructure projects involving design and construction management services. International segments also contribute notably to overall performance. Key growth areas include the Water and Environment Advisory business, propelled by the rising demand for sustainable solutions, and transportation design services, fueled by expanding global infrastructure investments. With a focus on high-margin operations and digital technology integration, the company continues solidifying its position as a leader in high-growth markets.

Activities

AECOM is a global infrastructure consulting firm headquartered in Los Angeles, California, providing professional services across various sectors. The company''s largest sources of revenue come from its Design and Consulting Services segment, which includes architecture, engineering, and planning for transportation, water, and environmental projects, and its Construction Services segment, which focuses on building and infrastructure construction management. These segments cater to both public and private clients, with significant contributions from government contracts in the United States and internationally. Among its fastest-growing areas, AECOM has seen notable expansion in its environmental and sustainability services, driven by increasing demand for climate resilience and green infrastructure solutions, as well as in digital consulting, leveraging technology for project efficiency. With a presence in over 150 countries, AECOM continues to strengthen its position as a leader in delivering comprehensive infrastructure solutions, adapting to global trends and client needs. It is the NYSE's 8th largest Construction company by market capitalisation.

AECOM PRESS RELEASES AND CORPORATE WIRE

August 11: AECOM selected to deliver project management and engineering services for The Avenues - Riyadh Phase II

AECOM (NYSE: ACM), the trusted global infrastructure leader, today announced it has been appointed by Shomoul Holding Company as the Project Management Consultant (PMC) and engineer for Phase II of The Avenues - Riyadh, a transformative mixed-use development in North Riyadh City, Saudi Arabia, following the successful delivery of The Avenues Phase I. The Avenues aims to be one of the most prominent commercial and investment destinations in the Middle East, elevating Saudi Arabia's position as a regional hub for business, innovation and lifestyle.

"We are honored that Shomoul Holding Company has entrusted us to extend our key role on The Avenues - Riyadh," said Hamed Zaghw, chief executive of AECOM's Middle East and Africa region. "This award is a testament to the transformational outcomes we are delivering for our clients across the Kingdom, and we are excited to shape a development that aligns with Vision 2030 and sets a new benchmark for mixed-use environments in the Middle East."

Valued at over $4 billion, the project spans 1,870,000 square meters of built-up area and 370,000 square meters of leasable area. It will include a luxury shopping mall and five towers featuring mixed-use functionalities such as hospitality, commercial and residential spaces. The Avenues - Riyadh is scheduled to open in early 2026.

"This appointment builds on our track record of delivering complex, high-profile developments that shape the cities of tomorrow," said Jason Kroll, chief executive of AECOM Arabia. "Our integrated team brings deep regional experience, digital delivery capabilities and industry-leading expertise in sustainability, and we look forward to collaborating with our partners to bring this world-class destination to life."

AECOM will deploy advanced digital project management tools, data-driven dashboards and lean construction methodologies to optimize project tracking, enhance stakeholder communications, and proactively mitigate risks-setting new standards for project delivery in the region.

NYSE STOCK REPORT

AECOM's share price is continuing to outperform that of KBR. AECOM's return over the past 3 months has been 14.2% and KBR's return has been -10.3% over the same period.

Company Name1 Month %3 Month%YTD %AECOM3.314.212.5KBR5.1-10.3-14.3

AECOM Snapshot

AECOM Latest Earnings Highlights

Highlights of the Latest Earnings Report Q2 Fiscal 2025

AECOM posted adjusted earnings per share (EPS) of $1.25, exceeding forecasts by 8.7% and marking a 20% increase compared to the previous year.

Revenues experienced a decline year-over-year, though net service revenues (NSR) rose by 1%, reaching $742 million, supported by strong performance in the United Kingdom and Hong Kong markets.

Operating cash flow significantly increased by 102% to $191 million, while adjusted free cash flow surged by 141% to $178 million.

The company's total backlog climbed to $17.78 billion, compared to $17.38 billion during the same period last year, securing strong future revenue opportunities.

Guidance for fiscal 2025 was raised, with adjusted EPS projected between $5.10 and $5.20 and adjusted EBITDA between $1.180 and $1.210 billion, alongside NSR growth expectations of 5-8%.

Adjusted EBITDA margins are anticipated to improve by 30 basis points, ranging from 16.1% to 16.3%, with over 100% conversion from adjusted net income to free cash flow expected.

International revenues dropped by 3% to $875 million; however, operational improvements contributed to a margin expansion of 10 basis points, reaching 11.1%.

Analyst Commentary

Strong Margin Expansion and Operational Efficiency

Observers highlight AECOM's ongoing progress towards achieving its goal of a 17%-plus margin. This success is attributed to a strategic focus on high-margin markets and efficient project execution processes that enhance profitability.

Operational efficiency, supported by disciplined cost management, has enabled reinvestment into high-return initiatives, further strengthening long-term competitiveness.

Robust Cash Flow and Capital Allocation

Exceptional free cash flow growth of 141% underscores the company's healthy financial position. This robust cash flow supports disciplined strategies, including consistent share repurchases and annual dividend growth commitments exceeding 20%.

Resilient Backlog and Pipeline Growth

AECOM's record-breaking backlog of $17.78 billion and a book-to-burn ratio of 1.2x in its design business signify continued demand. The infrastructure and environmental sectors are noted as drivers propelling global growth opportunities.

Exposure to High-Growth Markets

Growth in strategic areas such as transportation, water, and environmental services positions AECOM to leverage rising global investments in sustainable infrastructure. Advancements in AI and digital technologies further highlight avenues for growth in high-demand segments.

Challenges in Revenue Growth and International Markets

Challenges persist as revenues declined year-over-year, with international performance impacted by currency fluctuations and market-specific factors. Nonetheless, the company's focus on organic growth initiatives provides strategic support against these challenges.

Optimism for Long-Term Prospects

Industry-wide optimism underscores AECOM's resilience and alignment with essential global trends such as urbanization and climate change. Its steady earnings growth and ability to mitigate economic uncertainties affirm confidence in its long-term trajectory.

Company Profile

AECOM is recognized as a global leader in infrastructure consulting services, offering comprehensive solutions in planning, design, engineering, construction management, and advisory sectors. The Americas represent its largest source of revenue, driven by transportation and water infrastructure projects involving design and construction management services. International segments also contribute notably to overall performance. Key growth areas include the Water and Environment Advisory business, propelled by the rising demand for sustainable solutions, and transportation design services, fueled by expanding global infrastructure investments. With a focus on high-margin operations and digital technology integration, the company continues solidifying its position as a leader in high-growth markets.

Activities

AECOM is a global infrastructure consulting firm headquartered in Los Angeles, California, providing professional services across various sectors. The company''s largest sources of revenue come from its Design and Consulting Services segment, which includes architecture, engineering, and planning for transportation, water, and environmental projects, and its Construction Services segment, which focuses on building and infrastructure construction management. These segments cater to both public and private clients, with significant contributions from government contracts in the United States and internationally. Among its fastest-growing areas, AECOM has seen notable expansion in its environmental and sustainability services, driven by increasing demand for climate resilience and green infrastructure solutions, as well as in digital consulting, leveraging technology for project efficiency. With a presence in over 150 countries, AECOM continues to strengthen its position as a leader in delivering comprehensive infrastructure solutions, adapting to global trends and client needs. It is the NYSE's 8th largest Construction company by market capitalisation.

AECOM PRESS RELEASES AND CORPORATE WIRE

August 11: AECOM selected to deliver project management and engineering services for The Avenues - Riyadh Phase II

AECOM (NYSE: ACM), the trusted global infrastructure leader, today announced it has been appointed by Shomoul Holding Company as the Project Management Consultant (PMC) and engineer for Phase II of The Avenues - Riyadh, a transformative mixed-use development in North Riyadh City, Saudi Arabia, following the successful delivery of The Avenues Phase I. The Avenues aims to be one of the most prominent commercial and investment destinations in the Middle East, elevating Saudi Arabia's position as a regional hub for business, innovation and lifestyle.

"We are honored that Shomoul Holding Company has entrusted us to extend our key role on The Avenues - Riyadh," said Hamed Zaghw, chief executive of AECOM's Middle East and Africa region. "This award is a testament to the transformational outcomes we are delivering for our clients across the Kingdom, and we are excited to shape a development that aligns with Vision 2030 and sets a new benchmark for mixed-use environments in the Middle East."

Valued at over $4 billion, the project spans 1,870,000 square meters of built-up area and 370,000 square meters of leasable area. It will include a luxury shopping mall and five towers featuring mixed-use functionalities such as hospitality, commercial and residential spaces. The Avenues - Riyadh is scheduled to open in early 2026.

"This appointment builds on our track record of delivering complex, high-profile developments that shape the cities of tomorrow," said Jason Kroll, chief executive of AECOM Arabia. "Our integrated team brings deep regional experience, digital delivery capabilities and industry-leading expertise in sustainability, and we look forward to collaborating with our partners to bring this world-class destination to life."

AECOM will deploy advanced digital project management tools, data-driven dashboards and lean construction methodologies to optimize project tracking, enhance stakeholder communications, and proactively mitigate risks-setting new standards for project delivery in the region.

The company''s largest sources of revenue come from its Design and Consulting Services segment, which includes architecture, engineering, and planning for transportation, water, and environmental projects, and its Construction Services segment, which focuses on building and infrastructure construction management. These segments cater to both public and private clients, with significant contributions from government contracts in the United States and internationally. Among its fastest-growing areas, AECOM has seen notable expansion in its environmental and sustainability services, driven by increasing demand for climate resilience and green infrastructure solutions, as well as in digital consulting, leveraging technology for project efficiency. With a presence in over 150 countries, AECOM continues to strengthen its position as a leader in delivering comprehensive infrastructure solutions, adapting to global trends and client needs. It is the NYSE's 8th largest Construction company by market capitalisation.

AECOM PRESS RELEASES AND CORPORATE WIRE

August 05: AECOM Collaborates on $200M White House Ballroom Project

The White House has announced plans for a significant expansion project, appointing Clark Construction and AECOM to design and build a new state ballroom. The project, valued at $200 million, will feature a 90,000-square-foot ballroom that aligns with the architectural heritage of the existing White House, according to Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt. This announcement was made on 5th August 2025 and is set to enhance the White House's capacity for hosting events.

The new ballroom will replace the current East Wing and is designed to accommodate 650 guests, a considerable increase from the East Room's current capacity of 200. Press Secretary Leavitt emphasized that the ballroom will be "innately designed and carefully crafted," ensuring that its theme and architectural style closely mirror that of the main building. AECOM, recognized as the top design firm in the Engineering News-Record's 2025 rankings, will play a critical role in the engineering aspects of this project.

Construction is expected to commence in September, with the completion timeline anticipated to fall well within President Trump's current term. The East Wing, originally built in 1902 and expanded in the 1940s, will undergo modernization as part of this initiative. During construction, staff currently located in the East Wing will be temporarily relocated to facilitate the work, which aims to preserve the historical significance of the White House while enhancing its functionality.

Jim McCrery, CEO of McCrery Architects, which is part of the project team alongside AECOM, expressed commitment to maintaining the elegance and classical design of the White House. The project has garnered funding commitments from President Trump and unspecified private donors, reinforcing its importance to the administration.

urn:contentItem:6G89-GNT3-RSKD-B2CY-00000-00Plant theft is often overlooked - that's why it's on the rise2025-07-14T00:00:00Z2025-09-16T07:01:15ZLexisNexisPlant theft is often overlooked - that's why it's on the riseJenni Cauvain, Senior Lecturer in Sociology, Nottingham Trent University

Why wildlife crime and environmental damage should gain higher priority in terms of public attention, law enforcement and potential sanctions.

More than 180 plants were stolen from a well-loved public park in Nottingham called Arboretum in May 2025. This incident took place just days after volunteers had re-planted flowers and shrubs to repair damage from a previous theft in March. In April 2025, the nearby Forest Recreation Ground community garden was also targeted - roses and crops grown by volunteers were stolen, even a pond went missing.

Plant theft may seem trivial, but environmental and wildlife crime tend to be overlooked. This is precisely one of the reasons why it is on the rise. Research suggests an annual growth rate in environmental crime of 5%-7%, making it the third largest criminal sector in the world.

Globally, environmental crime has been valued at US$70-213 billion (£52-158 billion) annually. As with most crime, its true scale is difficult to estimate as it remains hidden. This is even more true for environmental crime that goes undetected.

Plant thefts in Nottingham where I am based are small in comparison, but they tell the same story of lucrative illicit opportunities for criminals where law enforcement and potential sanctions are low. It's most likely that people steal local plants to sell on for profit.

Get your news from actual experts, straight to your inbox.Sign up to our daily newsletter to receive all The Conversation UK's latest coverage of news and research, from politics and business to the arts and sciences.

Another reason for overlooking this growing trend in wildlife crime is that perpetrators, as well as much of society, may feel that this is a "victimless crime". Where plants, animals, watercourses or soil are "the victim", people don't feel as strongly because our ethics and value systems generally prioritise fellow humans and do not recognise non-humans as victims.

People may be more likely to care about mammals such as elephants targeted in illegal ivory trade, but environmental crime permeates every community in the UK, as the recent Nottingham cases indicate.

Stolen benefits

As a researcher in environmental sociology, I believe wildlife crime and environmental damage should gain higher priority in terms of public attention, law enforcement and potential sanctions. Not only because of the intrinsic value that non-human nature has in its own right, but because of the value nature brings to us humans.

Parks and green spaces known as "green infrastructure" are central to our wellbeing in cities. They bring environmental and social benefits in terms of air quality, urban heat island effect, surface flooding, carbon storage, biodiversity and health.

After the COVID pandemic, the importance of accessing quality green spaces for our mental and physical wellbeing became even more apparent. Visits to parks can reduce loneliness and anxiety, as well as foster a sense of belonging and community.

This has the potential to benefit the public purse too. Nottingham is currently involved in a national green social prescribing test and learn programme to demonstrate the benefits of nature-based activity.

Public parks are often also significant in terms of cultural heritage. This is not a new discovery. Historically, public parks were introduced in cities to improve living conditions, quality of life and as educational resources. The Arboretum - the city centre park recently targeted by thieves - was the first such public park to open in Nottingham in 1845.

When valued green spaces are the victim of crime, this is not a mere aesthetic problem. Wider social and environmental harms are inflicted upon communities and nature that depend on open green spaces to thrive.

This matters in cities like Nottingham that suffer from high levels of deprivation and poor health outcomes. My own research has shown that while Nottingham is often celebrated for leadership in green initiatives, it suffers from deep-seated social inequality and deprivation that are long-term challenges.

Social inequality is associated with crime and disorder in urban areas that creates a vicious cycle when the crimes target community assets such as public parks. It is beyond doubt that public parks being ransacked will negatively impact the quality of life in Nottingham.

It is likely that these crimes get dismissed as a minor nuisance because "only plants" were stolen, but this attitude serves to mask the broader trend of growing environmental crime and the damage this brings to communities. Unfortunately, this will further contribute to the likelihood of such crimes spreading in future.

Don't have time to read about climate change as much as you'd like?
Get a weekly roundup in your inbox instead. Every Wednesday, The Conversation's environment editor writes Imagine, a short email that goes a little deeper into just one climate issue. Join the 45,000+ readers who've subscribed so far.

urn:contentItem:6GDR-N7C3-RRTD-62K6-00000-00AECOM continues to underperform Stantec by 1.2% in the past month - what Analysts are saying2025-08-04T00:00:00Z2025-09-16T07:01:15ZLexisNexisAECOM continues to underperform Stantec by 1.2% in the past month - what Analysts are saying

NYSE STOCK REPORT

AECOM's share price is continuing to underperform that of Stantec. AECOM's return over the past month has been -1.3% and Stantec's return has been -0.1% over the same period.

Here is how AECOM and Stantec compare:

Company Name1 Month %3 Month%YTD %AECOM-1.311.14.8Stantec-0.120.633.4

AECOM Snapshot

AECOM Latest Earnings Highlights

Highlights of the Latest Earnings Report Q2 Fiscal 2025

AECOM posted adjusted earnings per share (EPS) of $1.25, exceeding forecasts by 8.7% and marking a 20% increase compared to the previous year.

Revenues experienced a decline year-over-year, though net service revenues (NSR) rose by 1%, reaching $742 million, supported by strong performance in the United Kingdom and Hong Kong markets.

Operating cash flow significantly increased by 102% to $191 million, while adjusted free cash flow surged by 141% to $178 million.

The company's total backlog climbed to $17.78 billion, compared to $17.38 billion during the same period last year, securing strong future revenue opportunities.

Guidance for fiscal 2025 was raised, with adjusted EPS projected between $5.10 and $5.20 and adjusted EBITDA between $1.180 and $1.210 billion, alongside NSR growth expectations of 5-8%.

Adjusted EBITDA margins are anticipated to improve by 30 basis points, ranging from 16.1% to 16.3%, with over 100% conversion from adjusted net income to free cash flow expected.

International revenues dropped by 3% to $875 million; however, operational improvements contributed to a margin expansion of 10 basis points, reaching 11.1%.

Analyst Commentary

Strong Margin Expansion and Operational Efficiency

Observers highlight AECOM's ongoing progress towards achieving its goal of a 17%-plus margin. This success is attributed to a strategic focus on high-margin markets and efficient project execution processes that enhance profitability.

Operational efficiency, supported by disciplined cost management, has enabled reinvestment into high-return initiatives, further strengthening long-term competitiveness.

Robust Cash Flow and Capital Allocation

Exceptional free cash flow growth of 141% underscores the company's healthy financial position. This robust cash flow supports disciplined strategies, including consistent share repurchases and annual dividend growth commitments exceeding 20%.

Resilient Backlog and Pipeline Growth

AECOM's record-breaking backlog of $17.78 billion and a book-to-burn ratio of 1.2x in its design business signify continued demand. The infrastructure and environmental sectors are noted as drivers propelling global growth opportunities.

Exposure to High-Growth Markets

Growth in strategic areas such as transportation, water, and environmental services positions AECOM to leverage rising global investments in sustainable infrastructure. Advancements in AI and digital technologies further highlight avenues for growth in high-demand segments.

Challenges in Revenue Growth and International Markets

Challenges persist as revenues declined year-over-year, with international performance impacted by currency fluctuations and market-specific factors. Nonetheless, the company's focus on organic growth initiatives provides strategic support against these challenges.

Optimism for Long-Term Prospects

Industry-wide optimism underscores AECOM's resilience and alignment with essential global trends such as urbanization and climate change. Its steady earnings growth and ability to mitigate economic uncertainties affirm confidence in its long-term trajectory.

Company Profile

AECOM is recognized as a global leader in infrastructure consulting services, offering comprehensive solutions in planning, design, engineering, construction management, and advisory sectors. The Americas represent its largest source of revenue, driven by transportation and water infrastructure projects involving design and construction management services. International segments also contribute notably to overall performance. Key growth areas include the Water and Environment Advisory business, propelled by the rising demand for sustainable solutions, and transportation design services, fueled by expanding global infrastructure investments. With a focus on high-margin operations and digital technology integration, the company continues solidifying its position as a leader in high-growth markets.

AECOM PRESS RELEASES AND CORPORATE WIRE

July 30: AECOM awarded two U.S. Army Corps of Engineers contracts for architecture and engineering services across Europe

AECOM (NYSE:ACM), the trusted global infrastructure leader, today announced it has been selected by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE) Europe District to deliver architecture and engineering (A/E) services under two new indefinite delivery, indefinite quantity (IDIQ) contracts. The contracts will support projects throughout Germany, Poland, the Benelux region, Czech Republic, Norway, and Denmark, and have a combined program ceiling of more than $490 million, encompassing both Military Construction (MILCON) and Non-MILCON funding sources.

"We are honored to continue strengthening our 30-year partnership with the USACE Europe District through this important work, which reflects our proven ability to deliver mission-critical infrastructure in complex, dynamic environments," said Bane Gaiser, chief executive of AECOM's global Buildings + Places business. "By aligning with host nation requirements, NATO standards, and sustainability goals, we bring together global expertise and local insight to help build resilient, future-ready facilities across Europe."

AECOM will serve as the prime contractor for both five-year IDIQ contracts, which cover multi-disciplinary A/E services for the design of new and renovated military infrastructure. AECOM has been delivering on the predecessor A/E contracts for more than 15 years. The work includes project planning, concept design, design-build packages, full design, permitting, environmental documentation, and engineering studies, aligning with U.S., host nation, and NATO-specific design codes and standards.

The projects will include both horizontal and vertical infrastructure development with a focus on resilience. The team was also recently awarded a five-year IDIQ contract to continue providing multi-disciplinary master planning and design services for the USACE Europe District in a program spanning 31 countries.

urn:contentItem:6GJC-GC63-RVG5-H0T5-00000-00AECOM's Earnings Growth Lags EMCOR Group - what Analysts are saying2025-08-21T00:00:00Z2025-09-16T07:01:15ZLexisNexisAECOM's Earnings Growth Lags EMCOR Group - what Analysts are saying

NYSE STOCK REPORT

AECOM's growth in EPS (earnings per share) has been 36% annualized over 3 years. Over the same time period its stock price has gone up 60.3% or 0% annualized.

In comparison, EMCOR Group's growth in EPS (earnings per share) has been 45% annualized over 3 years. Over the same time period its stock price has gone up 395.4% or 0% annualized.

AECOM's last trading price was $119.90 which implies a Price to Earnings multiple of 40.4. AECOM Snapshot

AECOM Latest Earnings Highlights

Highlights of the Latest Earnings Report Q2 Fiscal 2025

AECOM posted adjusted earnings per share (EPS) of $1.25, exceeding forecasts by 8.7% and marking a 20% increase compared to the previous year.

Revenues experienced a decline year-over-year, though net service revenues (NSR) rose by 1%, reaching $742 million, supported by strong performance in the United Kingdom and Hong Kong markets.

Operating cash flow significantly increased by 102% to $191 million, while adjusted free cash flow surged by 141% to $178 million.

The company's total backlog climbed to $17.78 billion, compared to $17.38 billion during the same period last year, securing strong future revenue opportunities.

Guidance for fiscal 2025 was raised, with adjusted EPS projected between $5.10 and $5.20 and adjusted EBITDA between $1.180 and $1.210 billion, alongside NSR growth expectations of 5-8%.

Adjusted EBITDA margins are anticipated to improve by 30 basis points, ranging from 16.1% to 16.3%, with over 100% conversion from adjusted net income to free cash flow expected.

International revenues dropped by 3% to $875 million; however, operational improvements contributed to a margin expansion of 10 basis points, reaching 11.1%.

Analyst Commentary

Strong Margin Expansion and Operational Efficiency

Observers highlight AECOM's ongoing progress towards achieving its goal of a 17%-plus margin. This success is attributed to a strategic focus on high-margin markets and efficient project execution processes that enhance profitability.

Operational efficiency, supported by disciplined cost management, has enabled reinvestment into high-return initiatives, further strengthening long-term competitiveness.

Robust Cash Flow and Capital Allocation

Exceptional free cash flow growth of 141% underscores the company's healthy financial position. This robust cash flow supports disciplined strategies, including consistent share repurchases and annual dividend growth commitments exceeding 20%.

Resilient Backlog and Pipeline Growth

AECOM's record-breaking backlog of $17.78 billion and a book-to-burn ratio of 1.2x in its design business signify continued demand. The infrastructure and environmental sectors are noted as drivers propelling global growth opportunities.

Exposure to High-Growth Markets

Growth in strategic areas such as transportation, water, and environmental services positions AECOM to leverage rising global investments in sustainable infrastructure. Advancements in AI and digital technologies further highlight avenues for growth in high-demand segments.

Challenges in Revenue Growth and International Markets

Challenges persist as revenues declined year-over-year, with international performance impacted by currency fluctuations and market-specific factors. Nonetheless, the company's focus on organic growth initiatives provides strategic support against these challenges.

Optimism for Long-Term Prospects

Industry-wide optimism underscores AECOM's resilience and alignment with essential global trends such as urbanization and climate change. Its steady earnings growth and ability to mitigate economic uncertainties affirm confidence in its long-term trajectory.

Company Profile

AECOM is recognized as a global leader in infrastructure consulting services, offering comprehensive solutions in planning, design, engineering, construction management, and advisory sectors. The Americas represent its largest source of revenue, driven by transportation and water infrastructure projects involving design and construction management services. International segments also contribute notably to overall performance. Key growth areas include the Water and Environment Advisory business, propelled by the rising demand for sustainable solutions, and transportation design services, fueled by expanding global infrastructure investments. With a focus on high-margin operations and digital technology integration, the company continues solidifying its position as a leader in high-growth markets.

Activities

AECOM is a global infrastructure consulting firm headquartered in Los Angeles, California, providing professional services across various sectors. The company''s largest sources of revenue come from its Design and Consulting Services segment, which includes architecture, engineering, and planning for transportation, water, and environmental projects, and its Construction Services segment, which focuses on building and infrastructure construction management. These segments cater to both public and private clients, with significant contributions from government contracts in the United States and internationally. Among its fastest-growing areas, AECOM has seen notable expansion in its environmental and sustainability services, driven by increasing demand for climate resilience and green infrastructure solutions, as well as in digital consulting, leveraging technology for project efficiency. With a presence in over 150 countries, AECOM continues to strengthen its position as a leader in delivering comprehensive infrastructure solutions, adapting to global trends and client needs. It is the NYSE's 8th largest Construction company by market capitalisation.

AECOM PRESS RELEASES AND CORPORATE WIRE

August 11: AECOM selected to deliver project management and engineering services for The Avenues - Riyadh Phase II

AECOM (NYSE: ACM), the trusted global infrastructure leader, today announced it has been appointed by Shomoul Holding Company as the Project Management Consultant (PMC) and engineer for Phase II of The Avenues - Riyadh, a transformative mixed-use development in North Riyadh City, Saudi Arabia, following the successful delivery of The Avenues Phase I. The Avenues aims to be one of the most prominent commercial and investment destinations in the Middle East, elevating Saudi Arabia's position as a regional hub for business, innovation and lifestyle.

"We are honored that Shomoul Holding Company has entrusted us to extend our key role on The Avenues - Riyadh," said Hamed Zaghw, chief executive of AECOM's Middle East and Africa region. "This award is a testament to the transformational outcomes we are delivering for our clients across the Kingdom, and we are excited to shape a development that aligns with Vision 2030 and sets a new benchmark for mixed-use environments in the Middle East."

Valued at over $4 billion, the project spans 1,870,000 square meters of built-up area and 370,000 square meters of leasable area. It will include a luxury shopping mall and five towers featuring mixed-use functionalities such as hospitality, commercial and residential spaces. The Avenues - Riyadh is scheduled to open in early 2026.

"This appointment builds on our track record of delivering complex, high-profile developments that shape the cities of tomorrow," said Jason Kroll, chief executive of AECOM Arabia. "Our integrated team brings deep regional experience, digital delivery capabilities and industry-leading expertise in sustainability, and we look forward to collaborating with our partners to bring this world-class destination to life."

AECOM will deploy advanced digital project management tools, data-driven dashboards and lean construction methodologies to optimize project tracking, enhance stakeholder communications, and proactively mitigate risks-setting new standards for project delivery in the region.

urn:contentItem:6GJC-9RR3-RXPN-R22X-00000-00AECOM's Earnings Growth Outperforms 3M - what Analysts are saying2025-08-21T00:00:00Z2025-09-16T07:01:15ZLexisNexisAECOM's Earnings Growth Outperforms 3M - what Analysts are saying

NYSE STOCK REPORT

AECOM's growth in EPS (earnings per share) has been 36% annualized over 3 years. Over the same time period its stock price has gone up 60.3% or 0% annualized.

In comparison, 3M's growth in EPS (earnings per share) has been -9.5% annualized over 3 years. Over the same time period its stock price has gone up 19.2% or 0% annualized.

AECOM's last trading price was $119.90 which implies a Price to Earnings multiple of 40.4. With an EPS growth rate of 36 that implies a PEG ratio (price/earnings to growth) of 1.12 when using the EPS growth rate of the past 3 years (investors prefer using a 3-year expected growth rate instead but each investor will have a different perspective on future growth).

3M's last trading price was $154.14 which implies a Price to Earnings multiple of 20.3. With an EPS growth rate of -9.5 that implies a PEG ratio (price/earnings to growth) of -2.14 when using the EPS growth rate of the past 3 years (investors prefer using a 3-year expected growth rate instead but each investor will have a different perspective on future growth).

AECOM Snapshot

AECOM Latest Earnings Highlights

Highlights of the Latest Earnings Report Q2 Fiscal 2025

AECOM posted adjusted earnings per share (EPS) of $1.25, exceeding forecasts by 8.7% and marking a 20% increase compared to the previous year.

Revenues experienced a decline year-over-year, though net service revenues (NSR) rose by 1%, reaching $742 million, supported by strong performance in the United Kingdom and Hong Kong markets.

Operating cash flow significantly increased by 102% to $191 million, while adjusted free cash flow surged by 141% to $178 million.

The company's total backlog climbed to $17.78 billion, compared to $17.38 billion during the same period last year, securing strong future revenue opportunities.

Guidance for fiscal 2025 was raised, with adjusted EPS projected between $5.10 and $5.20 and adjusted EBITDA between $1.180 and $1.210 billion, alongside NSR growth expectations of 5-8%.

Adjusted EBITDA margins are anticipated to improve by 30 basis points, ranging from 16.1% to 16.3%, with over 100% conversion from adjusted net income to free cash flow expected.

International revenues dropped by 3% to $875 million; however, operational improvements contributed to a margin expansion of 10 basis points, reaching 11.1%.

Analyst Commentary

Strong Margin Expansion and Operational Efficiency

Observers highlight AECOM's ongoing progress towards achieving its goal of a 17%-plus margin. This success is attributed to a strategic focus on high-margin markets and efficient project execution processes that enhance profitability.

Operational efficiency, supported by disciplined cost management, has enabled reinvestment into high-return initiatives, further strengthening long-term competitiveness.

Robust Cash Flow and Capital Allocation

Exceptional free cash flow growth of 141% underscores the company's healthy financial position. This robust cash flow supports disciplined strategies, including consistent share repurchases and annual dividend growth commitments exceeding 20%.

Resilient Backlog and Pipeline Growth

AECOM's record-breaking backlog of $17.78 billion and a book-to-burn ratio of 1.2x in its design business signify continued demand. The infrastructure and environmental sectors are noted as drivers propelling global growth opportunities.

Exposure to High-Growth Markets

Growth in strategic areas such as transportation, water, and environmental services positions AECOM to leverage rising global investments in sustainable infrastructure. Advancements in AI and digital technologies further highlight avenues for growth in high-demand segments.

Challenges in Revenue Growth and International Markets

Challenges persist as revenues declined year-over-year, with international performance impacted by currency fluctuations and market-specific factors. Nonetheless, the company's focus on organic growth initiatives provides strategic support against these challenges.

Optimism for Long-Term Prospects

Industry-wide optimism underscores AECOM's resilience and alignment with essential global trends such as urbanization and climate change. Its steady earnings growth and ability to mitigate economic uncertainties affirm confidence in its long-term trajectory.

Company Profile

AECOM is recognized as a global leader in infrastructure consulting services, offering comprehensive solutions in planning, design, engineering, construction management, and advisory sectors. The Americas represent its largest source of revenue, driven by transportation and water infrastructure projects involving design and construction management services. International segments also contribute notably to overall performance. Key growth areas include the Water and Environment Advisory business, propelled by the rising demand for sustainable solutions, and transportation design services, fueled by expanding global infrastructure investments. With a focus on high-margin operations and digital technology integration, the company continues solidifying its position as a leader in high-growth markets.

Activities

AECOM is a global infrastructure consulting firm headquartered in Los Angeles, California, providing professional services across various sectors. The company''s largest sources of revenue come from its Design and Consulting Services segment, which includes architecture, engineering, and planning for transportation, water, and environmental projects, and its Construction Services segment, which focuses on building and infrastructure construction management. These segments cater to both public and private clients, with significant contributions from government contracts in the United States and internationally. Among its fastest-growing areas, AECOM has seen notable expansion in its environmental and sustainability services, driven by increasing demand for climate resilience and green infrastructure solutions, as well as in digital consulting, leveraging technology for project efficiency. With a presence in over 150 countries, AECOM continues to strengthen its position as a leader in delivering comprehensive infrastructure solutions, adapting to global trends and client needs. It is the NYSE's 8th largest Construction company by market capitalisation.

AECOM PRESS RELEASES AND CORPORATE WIRE

August 11: AECOM selected to deliver project management and engineering services for The Avenues - Riyadh Phase II

AECOM (NYSE: ACM), the trusted global infrastructure leader, today announced it has been appointed by Shomoul Holding Company as the Project Management Consultant (PMC) and engineer for Phase II of The Avenues - Riyadh, a transformative mixed-use development in North Riyadh City, Saudi Arabia, following the successful delivery of The Avenues Phase I. The Avenues aims to be one of the most prominent commercial and investment destinations in the Middle East, elevating Saudi Arabia's position as a regional hub for business, innovation and lifestyle.

"We are honored that Shomoul Holding Company has entrusted us to extend our key role on The Avenues - Riyadh," said Hamed Zaghw, chief executive of AECOM's Middle East and Africa region. "This award is a testament to the transformational outcomes we are delivering for our clients across the Kingdom, and we are excited to shape a development that aligns with Vision 2030 and sets a new benchmark for mixed-use environments in the Middle East."

Valued at over $4 billion, the project spans 1,870,000 square meters of built-up area and 370,000 square meters of leasable area. It will include a luxury shopping mall and five towers featuring mixed-use functionalities such as hospitality, commercial and residential spaces. The Avenues - Riyadh is scheduled to open in early 2026.

"This appointment builds on our track record of delivering complex, high-profile developments that shape the cities of tomorrow," said Jason Kroll, chief executive of AECOM Arabia. "Our integrated team brings deep regional experience, digital delivery capabilities and industry-leading expertise in sustainability, and we look forward to collaborating with our partners to bring this world-class destination to life."

AECOM will deploy advanced digital project management tools, data-driven dashboards and lean construction methodologies to optimize project tracking, enhance stakeholder communications, and proactively mitigate risks-setting new standards for project delivery in the region.

"We are honored that Shomoul Holding Company has entrusted us to extend our key role on The Avenues - Riyadh," said Hamed Zaghw, chief executive of AECOM's Middle East and Africa region. "This award is a testament to the transformational outcomes we are delivering for our clients across the Kingdom, and we are excited to shape a development that aligns with Vision 2030 and sets a new benchmark for mixed-use environments in the Middle East."

Valued at over $4 billion, the project spans 1,870,000 square meters of built-up area and 370,000 square meters of leasable area. It will include a luxury shopping mall and five towers featuring mixed-use functionalities such as hospitality, commercial and residential spaces. The Avenues - Riyadh is scheduled to open in early 2026.

"This appointment builds on our track record of delivering complex, high-profile developments that shape the cities of tomorrow," said Jason Kroll, chief executive of AECOM Arabia. "Our integrated team brings deep regional experience, digital delivery capabilities and industry-leading expertise in sustainability, and we look forward to collaborating with our partners to bring this world-class destination to life."

AECOM will deploy advanced digital project management tools, data-driven dashboards and lean construction methodologies to optimize project tracking, enhance stakeholder communications, and proactively mitigate risks-setting new standards for project delivery in the region.

AECOM Snapshot

AECOM Latest Earnings Highlights

Highlights of the Latest Earnings Report Q2 Fiscal 2025

AECOM posted adjusted earnings per share (EPS) of $1.25, exceeding forecasts by 8.7% and marking a 20% increase compared to the previous year.

Revenues experienced a decline year-over-year, though net service revenues (NSR) rose by 1%, reaching $742 million, supported by strong performance in the United Kingdom and Hong Kong markets.

Operating cash flow significantly increased by 102% to $191 million, while adjusted free cash flow surged by 141% to $178 million.

The company's total backlog climbed to $17.78 billion, compared to $17.38 billion during the same period last year, securing strong future revenue opportunities.

Guidance for fiscal 2025 was raised, with adjusted EPS projected between $5.10 and $5.20 and adjusted EBITDA between $1.180 and $1.210 billion, alongside NSR growth expectations of 5-8%.

Adjusted EBITDA margins are anticipated to improve by 30 basis points, ranging from 16.1% to 16.3%, with over 100% conversion from adjusted net income to free cash flow expected.

International revenues dropped by 3% to $875 million; however, operational improvements contributed to a margin expansion of 10 basis points, reaching 11.1%.

Analyst Commentary

Strong Margin Expansion and Operational Efficiency

Observers highlight AECOM's ongoing progress towards achieving its goal of a 17%-plus margin. This success is attributed to a strategic focus on high-margin markets and efficient project execution processes that enhance profitability.

Operational efficiency, supported by disciplined cost management, has enabled reinvestment into high-return initiatives, further strengthening long-term competitiveness.

Robust Cash Flow and Capital Allocation

Exceptional free cash flow growth of 141% underscores the company's healthy financial position. This robust cash flow supports disciplined strategies, including consistent share repurchases and annual dividend growth commitments exceeding 20%.

Resilient Backlog and Pipeline Growth

AECOM's record-breaking backlog of $17.78 billion and a book-to-burn ratio of 1.2x in its design business signify continued demand. The infrastructure and environmental sectors are noted as drivers propelling global growth opportunities.

Exposure to High-Growth Markets

Growth in strategic areas such as transportation, water, and environmental services positions AECOM to leverage rising global investments in sustainable infrastructure. Advancements in AI and digital technologies further highlight avenues for growth in high-demand segments.

Challenges in Revenue Growth and International Markets

Challenges persist as revenues declined year-over-year, with international performance impacted by currency fluctuations and market-specific factors. Nonetheless, the company's focus on organic growth initiatives provides strategic support against these challenges.

Optimism for Long-Term Prospects

Industry-wide optimism underscores AECOM's resilience and alignment with essential global trends such as urbanization and climate change. Its steady earnings growth and ability to mitigate economic uncertainties affirm confidence in its long-term trajectory.

Company Profile

AECOM is recognized as a global leader in infrastructure consulting services, offering comprehensive solutions in planning, design, engineering, construction management, and advisory sectors. The Americas represent its largest source of revenue, driven by transportation and water infrastructure projects involving design and construction management services. International segments also contribute notably to overall performance. Key growth areas include the Water and Environment Advisory business, propelled by the rising demand for sustainable solutions, and transportation design services, fueled by expanding global infrastructure investments. With a focus on high-margin operations and digital technology integration, the company continues solidifying its position as a leader in high-growth markets.

Activities

AECOM is a global infrastructure consulting firm headquartered in Los Angeles, California, providing professional services across various sectors. The company''s largest sources of revenue come from its Design and Consulting Services segment, which includes architecture, engineering, and planning for transportation, water, and environmental projects, and its Construction Services segment, which focuses on building and infrastructure construction management. These segments cater to both public and private clients, with significant contributions from government contracts in the United States and internationally. Among its fastest-growing areas, AECOM has seen notable expansion in its environmental and sustainability services, driven by increasing demand for climate resilience and green infrastructure solutions, as well as in digital consulting, leveraging technology for project efficiency. With a presence in over 150 countries, AECOM continues to strengthen its position as a leader in delivering comprehensive infrastructure solutions, adapting to global trends and client needs. It is the NYSE's 8th largest Construction company by market capitalisation.
